revised_title: Earthquakes Felt at Brussels: A Letter from John Pringle, M.D.
tldr: In a letter to Thomas Birch, Dr. John Pringle reports on three earthquakes experienced in Brussels during the winter of 1755. The earthquakes alarmed the inhabitants but had no bad consequences. Dr. Pringle also mentions a letter about a river sinking in Wales, which he encloses for consideration by the Society.
